alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion; Pickens; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 3:37PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marion, northern Pickens, western Winston, western Fayette and Lamar Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 337 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hackleburg to 7 miles southwest of Vernon to near Crawford. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Winfield, Fayette, Haleyville, Vernon, Sulligent, Reform, Millport, Lynn, Pickensville, Guin, Hackleburg, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Kennedy, Detroit, Belk, Beaverton, Gu-Win and Ethelsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
